definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: The tailor took the students' measures for their new suits.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫給學生量尺寸做了他們的新西服。

sentences.english: I'll just take your measurements, sir.
But we have to take your measurements first.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們要先給您量量尺寸。

sentences.english: I have to go to the shop to be measured up for my suit.
sentences.chinese: 我得去商店量尺寸定做衣服。

sentences.english: Mother measured me to see what size of dress I should have.
sentences.chinese: 母親給我量尺寸，好知道我該穿多大號的衣服。

sentences.english: Please measure me for a new coat .
sentences.chinese: 請給我量尺寸，做一件新上衣。

sentences.english: My mother is measuring me for clothes.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽在給我量尺寸做衣服。

sentences.english: Please hold still, so the tailor can measure you.
sentences.chinese: 請不要動，裁縫師才能量尺寸。

sentences.english: Well, sir, can I take your measurements first?
sentences.chinese: 好的，先生，我可以先給你量尺寸嗎？

sentences.english: The tailor took my measure for anew suit.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫給我量尺寸做了一套新衣服。

definition: to make to order/to have sth made to order
to have something made to order
paper pattern as model in dressmaking/paper patten
to take sb's measurements/to measure sb up
